a.g: Have you not considered, [O Muhammad], how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Love, Longing, and Intimacy
And these stories have come in the Quran so that you may know through them the Way (Sunnah) of Allah in His servants who have passed before. There is nothing in the Quran except that it is guidance and light and a recognition from Allah the Exalted to His creation. At times He makes Himself known to them through Sanctification (Taqdis) when He says: "Say: He is Allah, the One, Allah, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born, nor is there to Him any equivalent." And at times He makes Himself known to them through His attributes of Majesty (Jalal) when He says: "The Sovereign, the Holy, the Peace, the Faithful, the Overseer, the Exalted in Might, the Compeller, the Superior." And at times He makes Himself known to them in His actions that are feared and hoped for, and He recites to them His Way (Sunnah) regarding His enemies and His prophets when He says: "Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with 'Aad of Iram - of the great pillars? Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?"

Striking them with stones of hard clay,
And He made them like eaten straw.
